text: There isn’t a time of year that’s particularly tough. The summer is usually particularly easy though - lawyers and clients all see to on long holidays and that generally means that the work load goes down
What skills are required in your position on a day-to-day basis?

I have a team that I manage, so the most regular skill I need is people management. When I am working on my own projects, probably the most useful skill is being able to think think of different ways of looking at a problem - no two projects are the same, so I need to be able to work out different ways of approaching them. That’s a skill that comes with practice.
A question for you - what skills do you think you are developing now that will be most useful in a career?

Well I have joined a Debate Club so I think that would prove to be very beneficial for me in terms of being able to quickly look at information and come up with arguments quickly and confidently.

I'm also participating in the TFL-Innovate-Competition
Where I will work in a group of 6 people and will be tasked to innovate something (I do not know what yet) but that will include good teamwork, communication and computer skills - hence will become an opportunity for me to really feel what is like to work with different people on a professional project and a chance to work on the skills I mentioned earlier.

I believe these are some of the many important skills you need for a career in anything - hence im taking up most opportunities available to me.  - It will also help me build my personal statement next year too.
